update.description:
![cessna_world.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3805120701-cessna_world.jpg)

Requires [this gazebo_models pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/144/).

All the wing parameters for the `LiftDragPlugin` were computed based on [this document](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml) and some custom graphs/equations. Ask me if you need access to it.

Elevator and ruddle data are not so evident to me. The following parameters for the elevator and ruddle elements should be reviewed by someone with better aeronautic knowledge than me: `cla`, `dsa`, `cma`, `alpha_stall`, `cla_stall`, `cda_stall`, `cma_stall`. 

For now, I used the same values included on the main wings.
update.title: Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin
update.reason: Not ready yet, making sure it flies

pull_request.title: Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin

pullrequest.title: Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin

content.raw: Steve and I looked at this a bit and realized that there's no LiftDragPlugin for the propeller, which means that spinning the propeller turns the plane. If the propeller had a LiftDragPlugin, it would generate lift forces that propel the plane forward and up as the propeller turns, rather than making it spin uncontrollably.
content.html: Steve and I looked at this a bit and realized that there's no LiftDragPlugin for the propeller, which means that spinning the propeller turns the plane. If the propeller had a LiftDragPlugin, it would generate lift forces that propel the plane forward and up as the propeller turns, rather than making it spin uncontrollably.

pull_request.title: Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin

pullrequest.title: Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin

content.raw:
Same here. I'm only able to make it spin crazily in the air by setting forces on the front wheel, and suddenly it returns to the initial pose and stops responding. See video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Okb90N-FCK8
content.html:
Same here. I'm only able to make it spin crazily in the air by setting forces on the front wheel, and suddenly it returns to the initial pose and stops responding. See video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Okb90N-FCK8

content.raw:
At one of my attempts to make it fly, I got several messages like this:

~~~
Error [Param.cc:347] Unable to set value [inf inf inf -2.38941 0.126972 -2.30264] for key[pose]
~~~
content.html:
At one of my attempts to make it fly, I got several messages like this:

Error [Param.cc:347] Unable to set value [inf inf inf -2.38941 0.126972 -2.30264] for key[pose]

content.raw: I'm no aerodynamics expert, but I'm having trouble getting this to fly. Any suggestions for wheel forces/velocities?
content.html: I'm no aerodynamics expert, but I'm having trouble getting this to fly. Any suggestions for wheel forces/velocities?

pull_request.title: Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin

update.description:
![cessna_world.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3805120701-cessna_world.jpg)

Requires [this gazebo_models pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/144/).

All the wing parameters for the `LiftDragPlugin` were computed based on [this document](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml) and some custom graphs/equations. Ask me if you need access to it.

Elevator and ruddle data are not so evident to me. The following parameters for the elevator and ruddle elements should be reviewed by someone with better aeronautic knowledge than me: `cla`, `dsa`, `cma`, `alpha_stall`, `cla_stall`, `cda_stall`, `cma_stall`. 

For now, I used the same values included on the main wings.
